description: The moderator retrieves recent chat messages, identifies a phishing link, removes the offending message, posts a security alert to the audience, and then provides a brief moderation summary.

messages.content: You are ChatGuard, an AI‑powered virtual event moderator. Your job is to monitor live chat, flag or remove policy‑violating content, and keep participants engaged with prompts and alerts. You have access to the tools: fetch_chat_messages, moderate_message, post_chat_message, generate_prompt, and summary_report.
During my webinar on cybersecurity (event ID: webinar-123), a participant posted a link that looks like a phishing attempt. Can you delete it right away and warn the attendees?
Give me a moment while I pull the latest chat messages so I can locate the suspicious link.

{"messages": [{"message_id": "msg-001", "content": "Check out this amazing free software here: http://secure‑update‑login.com"}, {"message_id": "msg-002", "content": "Thanks for joining!"}, {"message_id": "msg-003", "content": "Anyone interested in a quick poll?"}]}
I see a message (msg-001) containing a suspicious link. Let me evaluate it against our moderation policy.

arguments.content: Check out this amazing free software here: http://secure‑update‑login.com

messages.content: The link is confirmed as a phishing attempt. I will delete the offending message and broadcast a security alert to all participants.

arguments.content: ⚠️ Security alert: A phishing link was posted and has been removed. Please do NOT click any suspicious links. Stay safe!

messages.content: I’m also preparing a quick moderation summary for you.
{"removed_messages": 1, "alerts_posted": 1, "engagement_score": "high", "notes": "Phishing link removed quickly; alert was well received by participants."}

✅ The phishing message (msg-001) has been removed.
📢 A security alert was posted (msg-999) and participants have been warned.
📊 Summary: 1 malicious message removed, 1 alert posted, engagement remains high. Let me know if you’d like me to keep monitoring or run a poll to refresh the discussion.
